location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'APPENDIX C. MAP SHOWING THE EXTENT OF WAHABI AND OF MUSCAT POWER, 1865.'

physicalDescription.extent: Materials: Printed in colour on paper.Dimensions: 333 x 420mm.

mods.abstract: Map enclosed as an appendix to an India Office memorandum entitled 'Historical Memorandum on the Relations of the Wahabi Amirs and Ibn Saud with Eastern Arabia and the British Government, 1800-1934', dated 26 September 1934. The map depicts the south-eastern part of the Arabian Peninsula, with the Red Sea and the Persian Gulf on either side. Red and blue lines, which are referenced in a corresponding key, outline the respective areas of Wahabee [Wahabi] and Muscat power.
